goals.description: Given a timed reading passage, Carter will decode and read fluently with 85 correct words per minute at 80% accuracy in 3 out of 4 trials.
goals.baseline: Kindergarten level in phonics, recognizes lower and uppercase letters, matches consonant sounds to letters s, f, r, m, p, l, t, d, n, g, b, c, h in isolation, matches short vowel sounds a and i in isolation
goals.target: 85 correct words per minute at 80% accuracy in 3 out of 4 trials
services: small group direct instruction in reading decoding focusing on decoding short and long vowel sounds through systematic instruction in phonics, repeated instruction, guided practice, and teacher feedback

goals.description: Given a grade level text read aloud, Carter will determine the main idea of the text with at least one supporting detail with 80% accuracy in 3 out of 4 trials.
goals.baseline: Kindergarten range in vocabulary and comprehension of informational text, first grade range for comprehension of literature, can draw conclusions with support, compare and contrast characters with support
services: Small group direct instruction in reading comprehension focusing on main idea through guided practice, teacher feedback, and repeated practice

goals.description: Given a set of problems involving ratios, Carter will use multiplication properties or division properties to convert equivalent ratios with 80% accuracy in 3 out of 4 trials.
goals.baseline: RIT score of 449, 20th percentile, can multiply multi-digit numbers, divide four digit numbers by two digit numbers, compare decimals through thousandths
services: small group direct instruction in math application of ratios through guided instruction, repeated practice, teacher feedback, and anchor charts

accommodations.description: extended time (2x typical peers), small group testing and instruction of remedial skills, breaks during longer testing or assignment times, guided notes or anchor charts for new concepts, read aloud or text to speech that is at grade level or not on instructional level, calculator for tests that are not testing computation

presentLevels.academic: According to iReady diagnostic testing in May 2025, Carter scored overall Kindergarten level in reading (2nd percentile) and RIT score of 449 in math (20th percentile). Current grades: ELA D-, Math C+, Science B, Social Studies D-
presentLevels.functional: Carter benefits from small group instruction and requires supports to progress in general education classroom. He needs specific supports such as guided instruction, repeated instruction and feedback. Requires breaks during extended periods of testing or instruction over 50 minutes
presentLevels.social: Carter has had only one behavior log this year resulting in suspension for a fight. This behavior is atypical. He has missed 18 days and been tardy 8 days this school year

extractedData.placementJustification: The team considered general education instruction for Carter to receive direct instruction on his goals, however the team felt that Carter requires a space that allows him to focus on repeated practice, guided practice and systematic instruction, especially in the area of reading fluency. The team decided that he would receive specially designed instruction in a designated intervention area.
assessmentAccommodations: breaks during testing to allow for refocus
extractedData.additionalNotes: Carter has the same opportunity to participate in nonacademic/extracurricular activities with nondisabled peers. Progress reports provided every 9 weeks.
